title: Hideki Uchidate
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player.
Playing career.
Uchidate was born in <a href="Saitama%20%28city%29">Saitama</a> on January 15, 1974. After graduating from <a href="Sendai%20University">Sendai University</a>, he joined his local club <a href="Urawa%20Reds">Urawa Reds</a> in 1996. He played many matches from 2000 and he became a regular player as left defender of three back defense and defensive midfielder from 2002. The club won the champions <a href="2003%20J.League%20Cup">2003 J.League Cup</a> and <a href="2005%20Emperor%27s%20Cup">2005 Emperor's Cup</a>. In 2006, although he played as substitute, he played many matches and the club won the champions <a href="2006%20J.League%20Division%201">J1 League</a>. From 2007, although his opportunity to play decreased, the club won the champions <a href="2007%20AFC%20Champions%20League">AFC Champions League</a>. He retired end of 2008 season.
